job_tasks.justification: The term 'Back End Developer' directly implies tasks related to building and maintaining the server-side logic of applications, which falls under traditional software development as defined in this category.

The role of 'AI Trainer' suggests involvement in the process of developing, training, or refining AI models, aligning with the definition of model development and fine-tuning. The term 'AI Trainer' is interpreted as referring to the training of AI models themselves, rather than training users.

profile.rationale: The job description includes responsibilities that fall into both Macro-Category A ('Back End Developer' -> 1.A.1. Software Development & Integration) and Macro-Category B ('AI Trainer' -> 1.B.1. Model Development & Fine-Tuning). This indicates a balanced mix of core software engineering and AI specialization tasks. The term 'AI Trainer' is interpreted as leaning towards modern AI/GenAI, as this is a common connotation in the current tech landscape. Therefore, the Core GenAI Engineer profile is assigned.

confidence.reasoning: The job advertisement is extremely brief and lacks specific details about the nature of the backend development or the AI training involved. This makes a precise classification challenging, particularly in distinguishing between traditional ML and GenAI aspects based solely on the term 'AI Trainer'.
